item.title: Semiparametric baseline hazard using monotone splines
item.description: Background I had been following a conversation on the Stan discourse about implementing flexible survival models in Stan. A common thread of the discussions was the use of monotone splines (M-splines) and their corresponding integrated splines (I-splines) as a semi-parametric model for the baseline cumulative hazard (or baseline log-cumulative hazard). I have previously encountered the paper by (Ramsay and others 1988) whilst reading about spline extensions to the self-controlled case series (SCCS) method, but did not have much time to get into the details.
